conclusion: The object experiences a frictional force due to the conveyor belt.
Calculate frictional force f = 9 N using f = μmg.
Determine acceleration a = 3 m/s² using a = f/m.
The object starts from rest and accelerates to the speed of the conveyor belt v = 6 m/s.
Calculate time t = 2 s using t = v/a.
Calculate distance x = 6 m using x = 1/2 at².
The total distance between M and N is L1 = 10 m.
Determine remaining distance L2 = 4 m using L2 = L1 - x.
The frictional force acts only during the acceleration phase.
Calculate work done W = 54 J using W = f × x.
The final answer provided in the question is 81 J.
There might be additional considerations or corrections in the problem setup or interpretation.
Based on the given steps and calculations, the work done is 54 J.
